Why work hard to get around this Labor Day? Metro-North has extra early getaway service and plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long holiday weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_day.htm If you are traveling during the holiday, use MTA eTix, our mobile ticketing app. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo
West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Sept. 1 - 4)

Don't work hard traveling this Labor Day holiday! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, look for early getaway trains on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_dayWOH.htm

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Sept. 1 - 4)

Don't work hard traveling this Labor Day holiday! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, look for early getaway trains on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_dayWOH.htm

Why work hard to get around this Labor Day? Metro-North has extra early getaway service and plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long holiday weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_day.htm If you are traveling during the holiday, use MTA eTix, our mobile ticketing app. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo

LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The Cannonball, the LIRR's non-stop express train to the Hamptons operates today, departing Penn Station at 4:06 PM. All luggage MUST fit in the overhead rack or under the seat. Hamptons Reserve customers on the Cannonball please board on the first three cars of the train. If departing from Track 19, use the staircase to the left of the last LIRR ticket window. Melrose/Tremont Substitute Busing, Sat. & Sun., Aug. 5-6

Substitute busing will be in effect for northbound trains from Melrose Station to Tremont, all day Sat. & Sun., Aug. 5 - 6. For travel from Melrose to the Bronx or Westchester stations, use this schedule: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Melrose7_28.pdf Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. For travel to Melrose from Grand Central Terminal or Harlem 125th St., take a northbound train to Tremont, then switch to a southbound train back to Melrose. We appreciate your patience while we complete this important infrastructure work.
Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Sat. & Sun., Aug 5-6

Substitute buses will operate to/from Waterbury to Bridgeport for all trains Saturday & Sunday, August 5-6. For the schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WaterburyBus726.pdf Please note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we conduct this important infrastructure work.
